title: Persistent legacy of the Chernobyl disaster
text:
United Nations 
A/80/L.28
 
 
General Assembly 
Distr.: Limited 
4 December 2025 
Original: English 
 
25-19892 (E)    091225     
*2519892* 
 
 
Eightieth session 
Agenda item 72 (d) 
Strengthening of the coordination of humanitarian and 
disaster relief assistance of the United Nations, including 
special economic assistance: strengthening of international 
cooperation and coordination of efforts to study, mitigate and 
minimize the consequences of the Chernobyl disaster 
 
 
 
Ukraine:* amendment to draft resolution A/80/L.3 
 
 
Persistent legacy of the Chernobyl disaster 
 
 
1. 
Replace “Chernobyl” with “Chornobyl” in the title, the preambular paragraphs 
and the operative paragraphs. 
2. 
In the second preambular paragraph, insert “of Ukraine” after “Chornobyl 
nuclear power plant”. 
3. 
After the fifth preambular paragraph, insert a new preambular paragraph reading: 
 
Stressing that the fortieth anniversary of the Chornobyl disaster in 2026 presents 
a critical opportunity for all stakeholders to actively commemorate the event and 
renew their commitment to long-term recovery, resilience and sustainable 
development, 
4. 
In operative paragraph 1, replace “Takes note” with “Welcomes”. 
5. 
After operative paragraph 4, insert two new operative paragraphs reading: 
 
Expresses grave alarm at the damage arising from the drone strike of 
14 February 2025 against the New Safe Confinement structure at the Chornobyl 
nuclear power plant of Ukraine, which jeopardized decades of international progress 
in making the site safe and secure after one of the world’s most dangerous nuclear 
disasters; 
 
Stresses the importance of continued support from the international community 
and relevant authorities in repairing the New Safe Confinement, which is critical for 
upholding global nuclear safety standards and mitigating environmental risks in 
Ukraine; 
 
 
* Any changes to the list of sponsors will be reflected in the official record of the meeting. 

A/80/L.28 
 
25-19892
2/2 
 
6. 
After operative paragraph 7, insert a new operative paragraph reading: 
 
Decides to rename International Chernobyl Disaster Remembrance Day, 
proclaimed in its resolution 71/125 of 8 December 2016 and observed annually since 
2017, as International Chornobyl Disaster Remembrance Day; 
7. 
In operative paragraph 8, after “International Chornobyl Disaster Remembrance 
Day”, insert “, including by paying particular attention to the significance of marking 
this day in 2026,”. 
8. 
In operative paragraph 10, replace “Strengthening of international cooperation 
and coordination of efforts to study, mitigate and minimize the consequences of the 
Chernobyl disaster” with “Strengthening of international cooperation and coordination 
of efforts to study, mitigate and minimize the consequences of the Chornobyl disaster”.
